page.title: 03One Sunday in Leicester
page.content: Having woken up at 6.30 my brother and I went downstairs.I lit the gas fire and played some games. When Mum came down we had breakfast with my sister and my Dad. It was raining slightly. After reading my library book, I did some ironing until dinner. Pauline, my schoolfriend, visited so we could do homework together. In the afternoon Nan came down from her flat on the next estate for a special tea, as it was my elder sister's birthday the previous day. My sister stayed in the front room whilst we prepared the tea we had bought for her.We had{salmon sandwiches,ice-cream and{strawberries,}and a{birthday cake. We couldn't have {pork sandwiches}as some children may have done. We can't eat anything to do with pigs, as that is against our{Muslim}religion. Afterwards Nan went home on the bus.
